Key Match Events: The Lakers exploded in the first four minutes of the fourth quarter, dropping a sizzling 21-0 run to turn a seven-point deficit into a 108-94 advantage.
Sacramento responded with a series of mini runs to crawl within 125-123 of the Lakers with 55.1 left in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Lakers are now 3-0 while the Kings dropped to 0-2 following Saturday's game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings and the Lakers traded haymakers for most of the second half.
The Lakers played like the team with sufficient rest to open the game.
Others: LeBron James and Anthony Davis combined for 63 points, 23 rebounds and 12 assists to lead their team to victory.
Domantas Sabonis had 29 points, 12 rebounds, 10 assists, one block and one steal.
